summary.text:
LUMINA ENGINE

The main entry point for the Lumina presentation library.
Initializes the Vue application, sets up the store, and manages the component lifecycle.
Exports the current session state for LLM consumption.
Loads a Deck object into the engine.
Updates the existing deck with partial changes.
Cleans up resources and removes the instance from the cache.
Notifies other windows that this window is closing.
Sends a ping to check if another window is listening.
Sends a message to all connected windows on this channel.

Gets or creates a SpeakerChannel instance for the given name.
Uses singleton pattern to ensure one channel per name, unless forceNew is true.
The unique ID for the channel
If true, creates a new instance even if one exists (needed for in-context communication)
Checks if BroadcastChannel is supported in the current environment.

THEME MANAGER
Generates and injects CSS Custom Properties based on the configuration.
Gets the current resolved theme configuration.
Injects the requested theme into the document head.
A preset name ('ocean', 'cyber') or a complete ThemeConfig object.
Optional additional overrides to merge on top.
Payload for the 'action' event (e.g. button clicks).
Labels for the x-axis or pie segments.
A single dataset for chart visualization.

Color for this dataset. Supports Lumina tokens:
- 'c:p'  primary color
- 'c:s'  secondary color  
- 'c:m'  muted color
- Or any valid CSS color (hex, rgb, etc.)
Label for this dataset (appears in legend).
Numeric values corresponding to each label.

The complete Deck object.
This is the primary data structure passed to
Global metadata for the entire presentation deck.
Feature Item structure for Features Layout.
Content container - Groups child elements vertically with alignment control.
Fill entire container edge-to-edge. Default: true
Object-fit mode when fill is true. Default: 'cover'
Border radius. Default: 'none' when fill, 'lg' otherwise
Timeline element - Embedded timeline with events.
Duration of entry animations in seconds.
Duration of exit animations in seconds.
Stagger delay between sequential elements in seconds.
The style of entry animation for slide elements.
Map of event names to their payload types.
Fired when a user interaction occurs.
Fired when an internal error occurs.
Fired when a deck is successfully loaded.
Fired when the active slide changes.
Main initialization options for the Lumina Engine.
Whether to loop back to the start after the last slide.
CSS Selector for the container to mount into (default: '#app' or internal).
Theme configuration object or preset name string.

Slide: Chart Layout
Renders data visualizations using Chart.js.
Opacity of the background (0-1). Default: 1 (or 0.2 for default dark overlay)
The type of chart to render.
Unique ID for keying loop optimization (optional).
Speaker notes for this slide (supports basic markdown).
Chart title displayed above the chart.

Slide: Custom HTML
Renders arbitrary HTML content fullscreen.
Use with caution - HTML is injected directly.
Opacity of the background (0-1). Default: 1 (or 0.2 for default dark overlay)
Unique ID for keying loop optimization (optional).
Speaker notes for this slide (supports basic markdown).

Slide: Features Layout
A grid of feature cards.
Opacity of the background (0-1). Default: 1 (or 0.2 for default dark overlay)
List of feature cards to display.
Unique ID for keying loop optimization (optional).
Speaker notes for this slide (supports basic markdown).

Slide: Flex Layout
Flow-based layout for composing slides using semantic sizing.
Elements flow in order with size tokens (half, third, etc.) instead of coordinates.
Opacity of the background (0-1). Default: 1 (or 0.2 for default dark overlay)
Array of flex elements to render.
Unique ID for keying loop optimization (optional).
Speaker notes for this slide (supports basic markdown).
Padding around the entire container. Default: 'none'

Slide: Generic / Custom
Fallback for custom layouts or unknown types.
Opacity of the background (0-1). Default: 1 (or 0.2 for default dark overlay)
Unique ID for keying loop optimization (optional).
Speaker notes for this slide (supports basic markdown).

Slide: Split/Half Layout
Text on one side, image on the other.

content.text:
```json
{
  "type": "half",
  "imageSide": "left",
  "image": "https://example.com/photo.jpg",
  "title": "Smart Split Layouts",
  "paragraphs": ["Lumina adapts to viewport size.", "Content is King."],
  "cta": "Read Documentation"
}
```

summary.text: Opacity of the background (0-1). Default: 1 (or 0.2 for default dark overlay)
Unique ID for keying loop optimization (optional).
Image URL (optional if video is provided).
Which side the image appears on.
Speaker notes for this slide (supports basic markdown).

Metadata for individual slides.
Can contain arbitrary data used by custom layouts.

Slide: Statement Layout
A simple, high-impact text layout.

content.text:
```json
{
  "type": "statement",
  "meta": { "orbColor": "#3b82f6" },
  "tag": "Declarative Engine",
  "title": "Lumina V8",
  "subtitle": "A highly modular, performance-first presentation engine."
}
```

summary.text: Opacity of the background (0-1). Default: 1 (or 0.2 for default dark overlay)
Unique ID for keying loop optimization (optional).
Speaker notes for this slide (supports basic markdown).

Slide: Steps / Process Layout
Numbered steps with descriptions.
Opacity of the background (0-1). Default: 1 (or 0.2 for default dark overlay)
Unique ID for keying loop optimization (optional).
Speaker notes for this slide (supports basic markdown).

Slide: Timeline Layout
Chronological list of events.
Opacity of the background (0-1). Default: 1 (or 0.2 for default dark overlay)
Unique ID for keying loop optimization (optional).
Speaker notes for this slide (supports basic markdown).

Message payload for Speaker Notes cross-window synchronization.
Used by BroadcastChannel for bidirectional communication.
Action type for the sync message.
Preview info for the next slide.
Total number of slides in the deck.
Structure for items in the 'steps' layout.
Configuration for generating the system prompt.

Whether to include the full strict schema in the prompt.
If false, a shorter alias-based description is used (saves tokens).

Whether to include theming documentation.
Enables the LLM to generate custom themes.

The target model family. 
- 'reasoning': Optimizes for CoT (Chain of Thought) before JSON. Great for complex decks.
- 'fast': Optimizes for direct JSON output. Great for real-time.

Border radius scale configuration.
Values should be CSS size values (rem, px, etc.).

Color palette configuration.
All values should be Hex codes (e.g. '#EF4444') or valid CSS colors.
Tertiary/accent color. Used for special highlights.
Border color for containers, cards, inputs.
Main brand/accent color. Used for highlights, buttons, links.
Secondary brand color. Used for complementary elements.
Button border radius token or CSS value.
Card border radius token or CSS value.
Timeline line color (uses border if not set).
Timeline node color (uses primary if not set).

Configuration for the visual theme.
Comprehensive design token system for full slide customization.

Border radius configuration.
Defines rounded corner values for UI elements.

Color palette configuration.
Defines all colors used throughout the presentation.

Component-specific theming.
Fine-grained control over individual component styles.

Visual effects configuration.
Controls gradients, shadows, glass effects, animations.

Spacing scale configuration.
Defines consistent spacing values for gaps, padding, margins.

Typography configuration.
Controls fonts, sizes, weights, and text styling.
Override gradient start color (uses colors.gradientFrom if not set).
Override gradient end color (uses colors.gradientTo if not set).
Hover scale factor (e.g., 1.05 for 5% scale up).

Spacing scale configuration.
Values should be CSS size values (rem, px, etc.).
Font size scale. Values should be CSS size values (rem, px, etc.).
Font weight scale. Values should be numeric (100-900).
Letter spacing scale. Values should be CSS values (em, px).
Line height scale. Values should be unitless or CSS values.
Structure for items in the 'timeline' layout.
Child elements that can appear inside a content container.
Top-level flex elements that can have size.

Size tokens for flex element sizing.
Determines how much horizontal/vertical space an element occupies.
Generic handler function type for event callbacks.
Supported event names emitted by the engine.
Handler function type for processing speaker sync messages.

The main Slide Data structure.
A discriminated union of all supported slide types.
Spacing tokens used for gaps and padding.

Default Theme Values
Complete set of default design tokens for the Lumina Engine.

THEME PRESETS
Pre-configured themes that users can select by name.
Each preset only defines values that differ from DEFAULT_THEME.

Available presets: 'default', 'ocean', 'midnight', 'forest', 'cyber', 'latte'

Complete Theme Configuration Schema.
Comprehensive design token system for full slide customization by LLMs.

Feature: Dynamic Prompt Generator
Builds a system prompt customized for the specific needs of the session.

Generates a focused prompt for theme customization only.
Useful when you want the LLM to only modify the theme, not the slides.

Exports the JSON Schema for the Deck structure.
Useful for passing to OpenAI

Exports the JSON Schema for Theme Configuration only.
Useful for LLMs to understand all available theming options.

readme.text:
# Lumina Engine


JSON-Driven Presentation Engine

A lightweight, framework-agnostic library that renders beautiful, animated slide decks from simple JSON. Perfect for AI-generated content, dynamic dashboards, and interactive presentations.

Quick Start Layout Gallery

"> Agent Guide

[![Version](https://img.shields.io/npm/v/lumina-slides?style=for-the-badge&color=2563EB)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/lumina-slides) [![Downloads](https://img.shields.io/npm/dt/lumina-slides?style=for-the-badge&color=7C3AED)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/lumina-slides) [![License: MIT](https://img.shields.io/badge/License-MIT-yellow.svg?style=for-the-badge)](https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT) [![TypeScript](https://img.shields.io/badge/Written%20In-TypeScript-blue?style=for-the-badge&logo=typescript)](https://www.typescriptlang.org/)
### Build with AI Instantly [![Lumina Slides Agent](https://img.shields.io/badge/Try_on-ChatGPT-black?style=for-the-badge&logo=openai&logoColor=white)](https://chatgpt.com/g/g-6951593015fc8191bf8db3ff13ebe986-lumina-slides-agent) **Need a presentation fast?** The Lumina Slides Agent builds full slide decks from your prompts and shares live preview links in seconds.

--- ## Layouts & Gallery Lumina includes **7 built-in layouts** ready to use. Just set the

| [![Statement](https://pailletjuanpablo.github.io/lumina-slides/layout-statement.png)](https://pailletjuanpablo.github.io/lumina-slides/?deck=layout-statement) | | **Features** | Auto-grid layout for showcasing features, benefits, or stats. Adapts columns based on item count.

| [![Features](https://pailletjuanpablo.github.io/lumina-slides/layout-features.png)](https://pailletjuanpablo.github.io/lumina-slides/?deck=layout-features) | | **Timeline** | Horizontal timeline with snap navigation. Great for roadmaps, history, or process flows.

| [![Timeline](https://pailletjuanpablo.github.io/lumina-slides/layout-timeline.png)](https://pailletjuanpablo.github.io/lumina-slides/?deck=layout-timeline) | | **Steps** | Numbered step-by-step guide. Perfect for tutorials, instructions, or procedures.

| [![Steps](https://pailletjuanpablo.github.io/lumina-slides/layout-steps.png)](https://pailletjuanpablo.github.io/lumina-slides/?deck=layout-steps) | | **Half** | Split layout with image on one side, content on the other. Fully responsive.

| [![Half](https://pailletjuanpablo.github.io/lumina-slides/layout-half.png)](https://pailletjuanpablo.github.io/lumina-slides/?deck=layout-half) | | **Chart** | Data visualization with Chart.js. Supports bar, line, pie, and doughnut charts.

_ | [![Chart](https://pailletjuanpablo.github.io/lumina-slides/layout-chart.png)](https://pailletjuanpablo.github.io/lumina-slides/?deck=layout-chart) | | **Flex** | Declarative auto-layout system. Define structure with rows, columns, and nested containers.

| [![Flex](https://pailletjuanpablo.github.io/lumina-slides/layout-flex-demo.png)](https://pailletjuanpablo.github.io/lumina-slides/?deck=layout-flex)           |

> [!TIP] > **Embedded Mode**: All layouts can be rendered in compact containers (dashboards, widgets) by using the

option. > [!TIP] > **See the Code**: Click on the dropdowns below to see the exact JSON used to generate these slides.
Example: Timeline JSON

</details>

---

##  Theming

Lumina includes **6 beautiful theme presets** out-of-the-box. Just pass the name:

| Theme        | Description                         | Preview                                                                                                                                                   |
| :----------- | :---------------------------------- | :-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **default**  | Clean blue on dark. Professional.   | [![default](https://pailletjuanpablo.github.io/lumina-slides/theme-default.png)](https://pailletjuanpablo.github.io/lumina-slides/?deck=theme-default)    |
| **ocean**    | Cyan on slate. Calm and focused.    | [![ocean](https://pailletjuanpablo.github.io/lumina-slides/theme-ocean.png)](https://pailletjuanpablo.github.io/lumina-slides/?deck=theme-ocean)          |
| **midnight** | Indigo on black. Bold and dramatic. | [![midnight](https://pailletjuanpablo.github.io/lumina-slides/theme-midnight.png)](https://pailletjuanpablo.github.io/lumina-slides/?deck=theme-midnight) |
| **forest**   | Emerald greens. Natural and fresh.  | [![forest](https://pailletjuanpablo.github.io/lumina-slides/theme-forest.png)](https://pailletjuanpablo.github.io/lumina-slides/?deck=theme-forest)       |
| **cyber**    | Neon pink. Sci-fi futuristic.       | [![cyber](https://pailletjuanpablo.github.io/lumina-slides/theme-cyber.png)](https://pailletjuanpablo.github.io/lumina-slides/?deck=theme-cyber)          |
| **latte**    | Light mode. Warm amber on cream.    | [![latte](https://pailletjuanpablo.github.io/lumina-slides/theme-latte.png)](https://pailletjuanpablo.github.io/lumina-slides/?deck=theme-latte)          |

---

##  Quick Start

### 1. Install

```bash
# Core installation
npm install lumina-slides

# With Chart support (optional - only if using chart slides)
npm install lumina-slides chart.js
```

### 2. Implementation

Lumina is a **Framework Agnostic** class. It mounts to any DOM node.

---

##  Building Agents?

We have a dedicated guide for that.

> [!IMPORTANT] > **Read the [Agent Integration Guide](

)**
>
> Learn about:
>
> - **Streaming**: How to pipe token streams directly into the engine.
> - **Aliases**: Improve latency by 30% using

.
> - **Feedback Loops**: How to let the AI know what the user is clicking.

### Token Optimization

Lumina includes a built-in normalizer. Your LLM can output "lazy" JSON to save money.

| Concept        | Standard     | Short Alias |
| :------------- | :----------- | :---------- |
| **Header**     |

|
